data.constraints:
0 < [[N]] < 256
Input characters are in ASCII table from 00 to FF, and guaranteed to have at least one letter.
Output letters are 'a' to 'z'.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read S:string(N)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
Line 1: array's dimension [[N]] 
Line 2: an array of characters
data.outputDescription: Letters that are present in the array, in alphabetical order (converted to lowercase), each one repeated for how many times it appears in the array; endline after a sequence of repeated letters ends. It is guaranteed that there will be at least one letter.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to read an array of characters, and then you have to print out letters present in the array in alphabetical order, printing every letter however many times it appears in the array. For example, if the array is abcabcabcb, you have to print:
aaa
bbbb
ccc
So there must be an endline after the repetitions of a letter end. In the array there could also be characters that aren't letters: you mustn't print them. If a letter is capital, print it as lowercase.
Input
Line 1: array's dimension N
Line 2: an array of characters
Output
Letters that are present in the array, in alphabetical order (converted to lowercase), each one repeated for how many times it appears in the array; endline after a sequence of repeated letters ends. It is guaranteed that there will be at least one letter.
Constraints
0 < N < 256
Input characters are in ASCII table from 00 to FF, and guaranteed to have at least one letter.
Output letters are 'a' to 'z'.
Example
Input
10
abcabcabcb
Output
aaa
bbbb
ccc
